availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hugh W. Tener (Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, bookkeeper and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, bookkeeper and commissioner of deeds. Pennsylvania native. Member of the Independent Taylor Men of Philadelphia, organized to support presidential candidate Zachary Taylor, in 1848. Bookkeeper in Philadelphia in 1860. Vice president of the 5th Ward of the Philadelphia Democratic Party in 1862. Commissioner of Deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Pennsylvania in 1865.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, Philadelphia County, Philadelphia, p. 68; "Address to the People of Pennsylvania," Public Ledger (Philadelphia, Pa.), October 20, 1848, p. 2; "Local Intelligence," The Philadelphia Inquirer (Philadelphia, Pa.), August 25, 1862, p. 8.
